summaries.label: Threat Research Focus
summaries.text: Senior Threat Researcher with hands-on experience in ransomware analysis, APT campaign tracking, and adversary infrastructure hunting. Published numerous research articles and threat intelligence reports. Leads ransomware spotlight research and APT attribution using Diamond Model methodology. Built multiple production security automation tools adopted team-wide. Certified threat defense instructor who has delivered advanced workshops internationally for multinational groups, government agencies, and enterprises. Holds an approved patent for threat intelligence technology.

summaries.label: Tool Builder Focus
summaries.text: Threat researcher and security engineer who builds tools that solve real operational problems. Designed and deployed multiple production tools — including an AI inquiry pipeline, a threat intelligence platform adopted team-wide, VirusTotal hunting automations, and MCP servers — significantly reducing manual analysis time. Core components absorbed into a patent-approved enterprise platform. Published numerous research articles and threat intelligence reports. Pioneered Generative AI adoption on the team and introduced AI-assisted reverse engineering workflows.

summaries.label: Infrastructure & Vulnerability Hunting Focus
summaries.text: Senior Threat Researcher specializing in adversary infrastructure hunting and APT attribution using Diamond Model methodology. Identifies C2 infrastructure through internet scanning platforms, passive DNS, and network fingerprinting. Published numerous research articles and leads ransomware spotlight publications. Built production security tools including hunting automations and detection dashboards. Delivers advanced threat defense workshops internationally.

bullets.text: Published research articles on the company research blog covering novel ransomware families, APT campaigns, cross-platform threats, and EDR evasion techniques
Authored 14 X/Twitter microstory threads translating complex threat intelligence into actionable, widely-shared analyst content

Designed, built, and deployed production security tools including an AI-powered threat inquiry pipeline, a unified threat intelligence platform adopted team-wide, VirusTotal hunting automations, and MCP protocol servers — reducing manual analysis time across the team

Delivered advanced threat defense workshops for multinational participants sourced through INTERPOL and JICA programs, covering cybercrime operations, adversary emulation, and incident response across APAC, Africa, EU, and MENA regions
Led Advanced Threat Defense training curriculum internationally in Japan, Oman, and the Philippines for government agencies (DICT, USAID BEACON/CPIT) and financial sector enterprises
Keynoted at Philippine Airlines for Cybersecurity Awareness Month and presented at DECODE flagship cybersecurity conference, DOST ICT Summit, and CIRQIT enterprise security events
Tracked and documented evolving ransomware tradecraft including BYOVD, GPO abuse, safe mode exploitation, and cross-platform targeting of ESXi and Linux infrastructure
Conducted adversary infrastructure hunting using internet scanning platforms and passive DNS to identify C2 servers and track threat actor deployment patterns

Led CVE vulnerability hunting initiative with CVSS-based prioritization, producing hunting queries, detection rules, vulnerability intelligence reports, and campaign reports for high-impact vulnerabilities in widely-used tools and services
Led ransomware spotlight research for Agenda/Qilin group and contributed threat intelligence to multiple ransomware spotlight publications through the threat intelligence building group
Authored APT research reports tracking threat group attribution using Diamond Model methodology and infrastructure-level analysis beyond IOCs

Represented the Philippines threat hunting team in Critical Events monitoring alongside Japan and Cork teams, hunting threats related to global events (Osaka Expo, elections, Olympics) across newly registered domains, dark web forums, and internal telemetry in partnership with government agencies
Introduced Generative AI workflows to the team, including AI-assisted reverse engineering and AI-assisted memory and disk forensics for threat investigations
Co-inventor on an approved patent for a threat intelligence pipeline, with core components absorbed into an enterprise platform
Created hands-on lab content and CTF challenges for DECODE flagship conference for 2 consecutive years, covering red team to blue team transitions and AI-assisted cyber threat investigations

Proactively hunted for emerging threats using OSINT sources (VirusTotal, Malware Bazaar, ThreatFox) and internal telemetry (SPN, AWS Athena), identifying undetected ransomware families and naming them based on behavioral analysis

Wrote and maintained YARA rules for generic and specific malware detection, built daily-refreshing hunting dashboards, and developed VirusTotal automation tools for automated intelligence gathering and ransomware note extraction

Performed full malware analysis and reverse engineering on live samples across Win32, Win64, Linux, .NET, packed and obfuscated binaries using IDA Pro, Ghidra, x64dbg, and behavioral analysis tools to verify threats and build complete attack chains

Investigated infections from internal telemetry, distinguishing real attacks from test environments and honeypots, building full timelines and MITRE ATT&CK-mapped attack chains for spot reports and blog publications
Contributed threat intelligence to Ransomware Spotlight publications covering Play, LockBit, Akira, Rhysida, RansomHub, and other major groups through the threat intelligence building group

Completed intensive 6-month malware analysis training covering assembly programming (MASM), PE header analysis, binary and non-binary malware reverse engineering across Win32/64, Linux, .NET, packed and obfuscated samples, and network threat analysis

Analyzed malware across all major categories (ransomware, backdoors, trojans, worms, DLL sideloading, macro malware) using IDA Pro, OllyDbg, x64dbg, Ghidra, Process Hacker, Wireshark, and ProcMon in a practical exam environment with elimination-based evaluation

projects.name: Threat Inquiry Pipeline
projects.summary: AI-powered 9-phase automation pipeline that processes email threat inquiries end-to-end: understanding context, researching internally and externally, enriching IOCs, verifying detection coverage, drafting responses, and publishing documentation — autonomously within minutes

bullets.text: Architected a 9-phase pipeline automating the entire threat inquiry lifecycle: intake parsing, OSINT collection, IOC merging, URL reputation lookups, VirusTotal enrichment, automated response drafting, visual generation, and Confluence publishing

Reduced threat inquiry response time from 2+ hours to under 15 minutes by integrating AI for automated context understanding, multi-source research, and response generation with human review checkpoints

projects.name: Threat Intelligence Platform
projects.summary: Full-featured platform curating cybersecurity RSS feeds, news, and articles into actionable intelligence with IOC extraction, detection coverage verification, CTI-ready JSON output, hunting queries, and automated wiki publishing

bullets.text: Built a Streamlit-based threat intelligence platform that curates cybersecurity RSS feeds, news, and articles into actionable reports — extracting IOCs, checking detection coverage, generating CTI-ready JSON and hunting queries, all while auto-publishing to the team wiki
Platform adopted team-wide as the primary analysis workflow, replacing multiple separate tools with a single integrated pipeline

projects.name: Infrastructure Hunting Toolkit
projects.summary: Methodology and tooling for adversary infrastructure identification using internet scanning platforms and passive DNS to track C2 servers and threat actor deployment patterns

bullets.text: Built infrastructure hunting tooling leveraging internet scanning platforms and passive DNS to identify and track C2 servers across ransomware and APT campaigns
Developed network fingerprinting techniques to track threat actor deployment patterns and identify related infrastructure across campaigns

projects.name: VirusTotal Hunting Automations
projects.summary: Suite of automated threat intelligence gathering tools leveraging VirusTotal APIs for daily malware searches, behavioral analysis, ransomware note extraction, and YARA hunting notifications, plus automated feeds from ThreatFox, Malware Bazaar, and Triage

bullets.text: Built VT Intel automation performing daily VirusTotal searches across predefined hunting queries with time-based filtering, producing enriched CSV output with file metadata, detection results, threat classifications, YARA matches, and fuzzy hashes

Developed VT Extension tool adding behavioral analysis, file extension tracking, and ransomware note extraction to VirusTotal searches, reducing manual testing workload and improving bulk hash clustering efficiency

Created automated intelligence feeds integrating ThreatFox, Malware Bazaar, Triage, and RSS sources with MITRE ATT&CK mapping, ransom note extraction, and real-time team notifications via Microsoft Teams workflows

projects.name: Threat Report Generator
projects.summary: AI agent system transforming raw threat intel into structured security reports and publication-ready blog articles with auto-redaction

bullets.text: Developed an AI agent system that transforms raw threat intelligence into structured security reports with automatic PII redaction and publication-ready blog format generation
Standardized threat reporting format across the team, reducing report creation from 45 minutes to under 5 minutes and ensuring consistent quality across all published advisories

projects.name: Security Automation Suite
projects.summary: 13+ automation tools covering RAG report generation, malware-as-a-service analysis, AI chatbot, BEC investigation, PowerPoint analysis, and security log analysis

bullets.text: Built 13+ purpose-built tools for RAG-powered report generation, malware-as-a-service analysis, PowerPoint threat brief analysis, AI chatbot for threat queries, BEC investigation, and security log analysis
Automated recurring documentation and analysis workflows, replacing manual page creation, template application, and cross-referencing

projects.name: CTI Platform Connector
projects.summary: Model Context Protocol server connecting AI assistants to a production threat intelligence platform for natural language queries against indicators, campaigns, and relationships

bullets.text: Developed a FastMCP-based Model Context Protocol server enabling AI assistants to query a production threat intelligence platform using natural language for indicators, campaigns, and relationships — connecting AI workflows to 500K+ threat indicators

projects.name: AI Development Environment
projects.summary: Desktop GUI with autonomous pipeline orchestration, multi-model routing across 70+ AI models from 5 providers, and dual WebSocket architecture

bullets.text: Built a desktop application with autonomous pipeline orchestration, multi-model routing across 70+ AI models from 5 providers, SQLite session persistence, safety guardrails, and dual WebSocket architecture for real-time AI development workflows

projects.name: Research Knowledge Base Server
projects.summary: Server providing full CRUD access to a threat research knowledge base with 11 specialized tools for search, tags, backlinks, and cross-referencing

bullets.text: Created a server with 11 tools providing search, read, create, update, delete, tags, backlinks, and template operations for an AI-searchable threat research knowledge base containing campaign analysis, IOCs, MITRE mappings, and detection rules

projects.name: Threat Visual Generator
projects.summary: AI image generation server producing threat report visuals, attack chain diagrams, and presentation assets with brand styling

bullets.text: Built a server for AI-powered image generation producing threat report visuals, attack chain diagrams, timeline graphics, and presentation assets with consistent brand styling — automating visual creation that previously took 30+ minutes per asset

education.degree: Bachelor of Science in Computer Engineering

publications.title: CrazyHunter: BYOVD-Driven Ransomware Targeting Taiwanese Critical Sectors
Play Ransomware: New Linux/ESXi Variant Targets Enterprise Infrastructure
Agenda Ransomware Group Adds SmokeLoader and NETXLOADER
Warlock: From SharePoint Exploit to Enterprise Ransomware
